definition[0]: money that a business or organization receives over a period of time, especially from selling goods or services
example[1]: Strikes have cost £20 million in lost revenues.
definition[1]: money that the government receives from tax
example[2]: an increase in tax revenues of 8.4%
example[3]: The company has an annual revenue of about $8 million.
example[4]: We earn about £3000 a month in advertising revenue.
example[5]: a 10% fall in revenue from sales
definition[2]: money that a government receives from tax
example[6]: a government plan to help boost revenue
example[7]: The pensions are a good source of income tax revenue.
definition[3]: used to refer to the government organization in Britain that collects taxes
example[8]: The Revenue will not regard a backlog of work as a reasonable excuse for the late delivery of a tax return.
